page.title: 05Landscape - Silloth Green
page.content: The central attraction in Silloth, especially in the summer,is the{Green, which is about 40 acres in area. On the Green are 7 grass tennis courts, with 2 hard courts at the beginning of Skinburness Road. Round the edge of the Green are 4 public toilets and 2 car parks. Of the 5 shelters which overlook the Solway, 2 are on top of little hillocks. There are 2 pine plantations at the seaward edge of the Green, making quite a feature, along with the flower beds and shrubberies. Other items include a pony ride,a sand pit, paddling pool, a Kiddy Castle, wishing well, putting green, miniature railway track and a maze. The maze is only part-grown and is the subject of much local controversy.
